title: What do bands do during set breaks? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cool down, stretch your legs, change shirts if it's a hot summer night. Those lights are murder, all those news reports where so and so collapsed due to dehydration, it's the lights that did that and whatever weakened them in the first place. Check in with the crew about sound and lights and the crowd. Anything that effects the gig. Weather conditions for your safety and the audience. Basically it's work related stuff, some drinks can be passed around but no serious drinking because there's a bunch of work to do tearing down and getting home. Some people think it's a party but it's a job.

First thing - I usually get my drink refilled. When doing so…People usually come up and talk to you and ask you questions. Very rarely will I sit down with people. As a drummer, I like to stretch my legs and back a bit on breaks, and I usually like to try and save my voice - so I don’t like to have long-winded conversations. If it’s a concert or show. I’ll just hang out in the green room.
